question: Do you have a written Safety or Loss Control policy statement?
Was it signed by senior management?
Have all employees, board members/officers, and volunteers been trained on the policy?
Do you have a Safety Director? (If "yes", what is his/her name?)
Do you currently have a safety committee?
Are written minutes kept for safety committee meetings?
Are all levels of your organization evaluated annually for safety practices?

Do you have written personnel policies that require compliance with EEOC and applicable federal and state employment laws and/or written by-laws. (This question applies even if you only have volunteers at your organization. If you have checked “yes”, indicate which areas they cover).
Do you have an entity wide policy specifically prohibiting sexual harassment?
Does your policy make clear that your entity does not tolerate any form of harassment in the workplace?
Does your policy clearly state a mechanism for reporting allegations of harassment to someone other than the alleged offender?
Do you have objective and specific written job descriptions for all employees?

If you have employment positions that involve employees or volunteers dealing with minor children or vulnerable adults, do you perform criminal background checks prior to hiring for these positions? If you have no such positions, please indicate below
How many background checks did you perform last year?
Do you have individuals that drive on your organization’s behalf?
Do you verify that all employees who drive vehicles on your behalf have a valid driver’s license?
Do you have a copy of each of their driver’s licenses in your files?
Do you check DMV driver records for every employee who drives a vehicle on your behalf?
Do you provide training on safe vehicle operations to your employees? If the answer is “yes”, who provides this training?
Do you do regular preventative maintenance on all entity owned or leased vehicles?
Do you verify that all vehicles driven by employees on work-related duties (whether private or entity-owned) are properly insured and registered with valid inspections?
Do you have a policy to, and do you perform root cause analyses in the event of automobile accidents?
What action is taken as a result of these analyses?
Do you have a program for recognizing safe drivers and accident-free driving? If “yes”, how do you recognize these drivers?
Do you inspect your facilities regularly for unaddressed hazards and unsafe conditions? If so, how often are these inspections carried out?
Do you use a form or checklist to document building/facility inspections?
Do you address each noted deficiency and prioritize repairs according to importance, based on life safety and cost?
Are all buildings in compliance with all applicable fire and other safety codes?
If fire detection and suppression systems are required by code are they present and tested periodically?

section: Section 5: Cooperation With BRIM Loss Control Efforts
question: Do you understand that cooperation with BRIM and its vendors in scheduling meetings and other loss control efforts is a factor we consider in rating this questionnaire?

section: Section 5: Cooperation With BRIM Loss Control Efforts
question: If received, have you submitted written responses to all BRIM and vendor recommendations within 45 days of receipt and substantially implemented all recommendations within 90 days of your submission; or as alternative to full implementation, submitted a plan of action (for BRIM approval) for addressing all recommendations?

section: Section 5: Cooperation With BRIM Loss Control Efforts
question: Have you submitted the Loss Control Questionnaire form and supporting documentation by the published deadline?
